headline: Warren Escalates Fight With Facebook Over Political Ads
summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren sought to turn Facebook’s political ad policy against it, running an ad with a false claim about Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to highlight complaints about the social-media giant’s handling of misinformation.

headline: Nationals Take 2-0 Lead in NLCS
summary: Max Scherzer carried a no-hitter into the seventh inning in Game 2 of the National League Championship Series in the Nationals’ 3-1 victory.

headline: UAW Increases Strike Pay for GM Factory Workers
summary: The UAW said GM workers on the picket line will see weekly strike pay increase to $275 from $250, a sign the union is preparing to extend a nearly monthlong walkout.

headline: China Emerges With Wins From U.S. Trade Truce
summary: The U.S. shelved new tariffs against China while leaving many demands to be worked out later. The truce opens an opportunity for Beijing to kick down the road concessions that it doesn’t want to make.

headline: Turkish Troops Appear to Seize Syrian Town in Fourth Day of Invasion
summary: Turkish troops moved into a Kurdish-held Syrian town, forcing thousands of people to flee as Turkey pursued an invasion of northeastern Syria with heavy artillery and aerial bombardments despite fresh sanction threats from the Trump administration.

headline: Corn Mazes Grow in Popularity—and Complexity
summary: Farms across the country have made corn mazes a part of their autumn slate of offerings. And they are hiring maze designers to create devilishly confusing trails. Our reporter tries out two popular mazes in the New York metro area.

headline: Four Shot Dead in Apparent Brooklyn Gambling Den
summary: Four people were killed and three wounded Saturday morning when shooting erupted in what appeared to be an illegal gambling den in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, New York Police Department officials said.

headline: Marijuana Madness Turns Into a Cannabis Crash
summary: Share prices of marijuana producers tumbled this week, some by nearly 40%, after a string of disappointing quarterly reports and mounting skepticism about the industry’s rosy growth forecasts.

headline: Power Meets Power as Yankees, Astros Collide in ALCS
summary: In one of the most anticipated LCS match-ups in years, Houston’s strikeout pitchers will oppose New York’s home run-mashing lineup.

headline: Hong Kong Protesters to Trump: We’re Not Done Yet
summary: Thousands of antigovernment protesters in Hong Kong marched from a historic clock tower through a shopping district in a demonstration that some hoped would show the U.S. president the movement still has momentum.

headline: Xi and Modi Talk Up Trade, but Turn Aside Touchy Topics
summary: The leaders of China and India wrapped up two days of meetings by agreeing to find ways to step up trade, but they steered clear of thornier issues such as Kashmir and the 5G prospects of Chinese tech powerhouse Huawei.

headline: Blackstone Talked With Citadel About Buying Stake
summary: Blackstone has discussed buying a stake in Ken Griffin’s Citadel, whose hedge fund could be worth between $5 billion and $7 billion.

headline: Wolf Resurgence in Washington State Tests Limits of Civility
summary: Washington state’s growing population of gray wolves is exposing deep divisions among residents and testing civility among its top decision makers.

headline: Nationals Take Series Lead After a Pitching Gem
summary: Aníbal Sánchez delivered an unexpected October masterpiece—allowing only one hit in Washington’s 2-0 win over St. Louis in Game 1 of the NLCS.

headline: Banks Poised to Underwhelm This Earnings Season
summary: The Wall Street arms of banks won’t be giving their Main Street counterparts much help this earnings season.

headline: Finding Meaning in Quantitative Easing
summary: The Federal Reserve has been clear that its latest Treasury-buying plan shouldn’t be construed as QE, or quantitative easing. They may have a point.

headline: Global Trade Made Gorgeous
summary: Peabody Essex Museum’s reinstalled Asian Export Art Gallery highlights the region’s diverse creativity while not shying away from troubles trade wrought.

headline: The Reasons Women Don’t Get the Feedback They Need
summary: Research shows that getting ahead requires constructive criticism—and that many women don’t get those frank assessments.

headline: Women Are Less Likely to Delegate Than Men—and That Might Hurt Them
summary: When women don’t delegate, they have less time for big-picture work and mentoring.

headline: What Matters This Week in the 2020 Race
summary: This week the Democratic field seemed to separate into two heavyweight contenders—former Vice President Joe Biden and Sen. Elizabeth Warren—followed by everybody else.

headline: Google Shuts Out Payday Loans With App-Store Ban
summary: Google has barred high-interest consumer loan services from the Google Play app store, limiting payday lenders’ ability to access users of Android devices.

headline: What’s News: World-Wide
summary: What’s News: World-Wide

headline: The Impatience of Choreographer Mark Morris
summary: In a new memoir, a dance pioneer characterizes his style as simultaneously contrarian and conservative

headline: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: PG&E’s Big Blackout Is Only the Beginning
summary: PG&E Corp.’s decision to shut off power to more than two million Californians this week represents a new reality: It now plans to pull the plug as a desperation measure whenever its equipment threatens to spark destructive wildfires that can kill people.

headline: Africa’s Rollout of World’s First Malaria Vaccine Takes Flight—on Drones
summary: Health workers, tech startups and package-delivery giant UPS have joined forces to ensure children receive all four potentially lifesaving shots.

headline: Eliud Kipchoge Smashes Running’s ‘Last Great Barrier’ With Sub-2-Hour Marathon
summary: Kenyan marathoner Eliud Kipchoge became the first human to run a marathon in under two hours, covering the 26.2-mile distance in a once inconceivable 1 hour, 59 minutes and 40 seconds, during a specially-tailored event in Vienna.

headline: Test for Colleges This Fall: Does Criminalizing Hazing Tame Fraternities?
summary: Pledging season for college fraternities is in high gear across the U.S., and this year they face stricter safety protocols and more state laws that criminalize hazing.

headline: NBA Stars Study Hollywood’s Playbook in China
summary: With their own lucrative brands to protect, basketball players now have to navigate sensitive relations with Beijing. It’s time to learn the rules that American movie stars have followed for decades.

headline: U.S., China Move Forward on Trade
summary: The U.S. and China took an initial step to cement a trade agreement that had been derailed, with Washington saying it would shelve a planned increase in tariffs on Chinese goods, while Beijing would buy more U.S. farm products.

headline: Inside Notes Illuminate How Supreme Court Decided Major Cases
summary: Does the Constitution guarantee the right to burn the American flag? Justices’ conference notes reveal how the case sharply divided the Supreme Court, forcing some to choose between their heads and their hearts—and one to switch her vote.

headline: America Is Losing the Chinese Shopper
summary: China was once eager to spend on U.S. brands. Then citizens of the world’s biggest country shifted their allegiances.
